unit_learning_outcomes.description: demonstrate a coherent and advanced knowledge of the principles and concepts within the discipline area.
critically evaluate the arguments of others to arrive at reasonable and meaningful conclusions, and formulate and apply ideas to new contexts.
critically evaluate and synthesise knowledge sources.
articulate clearly a coherent argument in written, oral and technical communication skill as relevant to the specific needs of the discipline.
identify and provide solutions to complex problems with intellectual independence.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Preparation for an consolidation of workshop content.

assessments.description: A collation of work produced during the unit.

data.subject_search_title: PHYS7912 - Physics and Astronomy Special Coursework Topic
data.description: This unit will provide students with a bespoke coursework-based learning path in physics and/or astronomy, tailored to the students' individual development needs. The unit will use a mixture of existing lecture content and established teaching laboratories, further enriched by individually-guided study.
